channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024020925
item.description:
Report X-2024020925

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found with all its edges soaked and leaking through the closures. The package was placed into a plastic hazardous bag and then into a red tote to mitigate any additional spillage. The tote was then transferred to the hazmat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: The lid of the bottle was completely off which resulted in a leakage. The entire inside of the box was soaked with the gel sanitizer. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside of a hazardous plastic bag and then into a red tote to mitigate any additional leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024020981
item.description:
Report X-2024020981

  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking package was removed from sort, placed in a lined tote, and brought to the HWPA for evaluation. DescribePack: Two of the 12 cans in the shipment were punctured by the rims of the cans next to them. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The carton was placed in a lined tote. The leakage was largely confined to the carton.

item.title: Report X-2024021062
item.description:
Report X-2024021062

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiber board box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained 38 glass bottles in individual plastic bags with dunnage material. Three of the bottles inside were broken releasing contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was in transport to the van line when the package started to leak. Upon discovery the package was placed into a black tote and brought to QA. DescribePack: Shipping container wet at the corner of the package. Two bottles of the solution are cracked at the seam under the handle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: containers sat upright to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024020346
item.description:
Report E-2024020346

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding (6) 1-qaurt containers of Klean Strip Acetone that were crushed and punctured by a forklift. This resulted in the release of 2-quarts of Acetone onto the concrete dock floor. A Contractor cleaned the spill and containerized the damaged product into a UN-rated shipping container for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024020676
item.description:
Report X-2024020676

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024020676-SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found on unload. Removed from operations, placed in lined tote and taken to HMPA. DOT Class 3 label was found printed on the packaging but no HAZ svc code or envelopes for paperwork were found. DescribePack: One 1-gallon plastic bottle lost 0.6 gallon of fluid due to a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used. X-2024020684-SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found on unload. Removed from operations, placed in lined tote and taken to HMPA. DOT Class 3 label was found printed on the packaging but no HAZ svc code or envelopes for paperwork were found. DescribePack: One 1-gallon plastic bottle lost 0.2 gallon of fluid due to a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used. X-2024020685-SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found on unload. Removed from operations, placed in lined tote and taken to HMPA. DOT Class 3 label was found printed on the packaging but no HAZ svc code or envelopes for paperwork were found. DescribePack: One 1-gallon plastic bottle lost 0.4 gallon of fluid due to a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

DescribePack: Three of three 121oz plastic bottles collectively lost 35oz of fluid due to loose cap closures, despite child-resistant caps.   • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being sorted to the van when it fell off of the line and hit the ground. Upon impact with the ground the caps came off of the containers and the liquid contents spilled out. DescribePack: Caps loosely on the gallon containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Containers were placed upright to stop the spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found with pH ~ 1-2. Package removed from operations and taken to HMPA in lined tote. DescribePack: One of two 1 gallon plastic jerricans lost 1 gallon of fluid via pinhole puncture due to impact with sharp object. Please note that pinhole effectively sealed itself, even withstanding light pressure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024020670
item.description:
Report X-2024020670

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler delivered HAZMAT to truck to be loaded and set the package down. Package Handler started noticing a smell and turned to find it leaking and immediately notified management. Ops Mgr Nate Perry and Ops Mgr Mike Martin controlled the disturbed area and were able to contain the spill/HAZMAT. DescribePack: 1 glass 4 Liter bottle broken in half DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Ops Mgr's Nate and Mike contained the spill using folding absorbent pads.

item.title: Report I-2023110061
item.description:
Report I-2023110061

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-24T00:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREATWIDE AMERICAN TRANS-FREIGHT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The driver departed from the shipper and was making a left hand turn when the trailer and then the tractor over-turned onto it's passenger side. The Chattanooga Fire Department responded and Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI) was contracted, by Greatwide, to perform cleanup and environmental remediation. During the incident, one tote containing organic peroxide solution was crushed, causing material to spill from multiple pinch points in the plastic tote. A 2nd tote spilled approximately 150 gallons from a broken lid on the fill port. Approx 270 gallons total of material spilled into the trailer, onto 100 feet of roadway, and into a storm water drain. The drain flows to Moccasin Bend Water Treatment Facility (MBWTF). No organic peroxide solution entered a natural waterway or soil. All spilled material was contained in the trailer, on the roadway, and the storm water drain. After coordinating with MBWTF personnel, the fire department flushed the drain and pushed all spilled material into the MBWTF for treatment. Sand was placed on the roadway and around the doors of the trailer to contain the spill. MEI personnel pumped the contents from all 13 of the original totes and transferred the product into 15 new totes. The shipper transported the empty totes and new totes containing product back to their facility. MEI cleaned the interior of the trailer and roadway.
